intro: Antennaria aureola, commonly known as the golden willow or yellow sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of North America and Eurasia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its mat-forming growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant features hairy, glandular stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, yellowish hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically pink to yellow in color, and they bloom in early summer. Antennaria aureola is adapted to harsh, cold environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
